data.title: STOCKS | Japan's Topix Index Reaches Record High
data.description: Japan's Topix Index has surged to a historic peak, marking a significant milestone in the country's stock market. According to Jin10, this achievement reflects growing investor confidence and positive economic indicators in Japan. The rise in the Topix Index is attributed to robust corporate earnings and favorable market conditions, which have bolstered investor sentiment. Analysts suggest that this upward trend may continue if the current economic environment remains stable. The record high of the Topix Index underscores the resilience of Japan's financial markets amid global economic uncertainties.

data.title: Pentagon Mistakenly Downs U.S. Drone on Texas-Mexico Border
data.description: The Pentagon has inadvertently shot down a U.S. Customs and Border Protection drone along the Texas-Mexico border using a high-energy laser. Bloomberg posted on X, citing sources familiar with the incident. The mishap highlights the complexities and potential risks associated with deploying advanced military technology in border security operations. The incident is under investigation to determine the circumstances that led to the accidental engagement. Further details on the operational protocols and safety measures are expected to be reviewed to prevent similar occurrences in the future.

data.title: Boustead Singapore's Real Estate Trust Launches IPO to Raise $770 Million
data.description: Boustead Singapore's real estate investment trust has begun accepting investor orders for an initial public offering (IPO) that could generate up to $770 million. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting that this IPO is set to be one of the largest in Singapore in recent years. The offering marks a significant move in the city-state's financial market, attracting considerable attention from investors. The trust aims to capitalize on the robust demand for real estate investments, positioning itself as a key player in the sector. This development underscores the growing interest in Singapore's real estate market, reflecting broader economic trends in the region.

data.title: South Korea to Install 50,000 GPUs in AI Data Center
data.description: South Korea's Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport has announced plans to install 50,000 GPUs in a new artificial intelligence data center. According to Jin10, this initiative is part of the country's broader strategy to enhance its AI capabilities and infrastructure. The data center aims to support various AI-driven applications and services, contributing to South Korea's technological advancement. The installation of these GPUs is expected to significantly boost computational power, facilitating more efficient data processing and analysis. This move aligns with South Korea's commitment to becoming a leader in the AI sector, leveraging cutting-edge technology to drive innovation and economic growth.

data.title: LayerZero Labs co-founder: All remaining STG held by DAO has been destroyed; ZRO exchange contracts are still open.
data.description: Bryan Pellegrino, co-founder and CEO of LayerZero Labs, stated on social media that, as previously promised, all remaining STG tokens held by the DAO have been burned. He also noted that the STG-to-ZRO contract remains open to users, and the related renaming and exchange process is ongoing.

data.title: Wikipedia co-author: Bitcoin may struggle to become a dominant currency; its price could fall below $10,000 by 2050.
data.description: Wikipedia co-founder Jimmy Wales posted on social media that while the view that Bitcoin will "go to zero" may not be accurate, its long-term price prospects remain questionable. He pointed out that the Bitcoin network is relatively robust in design and will likely continue to operate unless there are extreme circumstances such as major cryptographic vulnerabilities or 51% attacks. However, he believes that Bitcoin may not achieve dominance as a currency or store of value. Based on this assessment, Wales stated that by 2050, the price of Bitcoin may fall back to below $10,000 in present value, or even lower.

null
source: https://x.com/BSCNews/status/2027198750347640938

data.title: IMF Approves $8.1 Billion Financing Program for Ukraine
data.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sanctioned a four-year financing initiative for Ukraine, amounting to approximately $8.1 billion. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting that this program aims to support Ukraine's economic stability and reform efforts amid ongoing challenges. The funding is expected to bolster the country's financial resilience and facilitate necessary structural adjustments. This decision underscores the IMF's commitment to aiding Ukraine in navigating its economic hurdles and fostering sustainable growth.

data.title: South Korean Supreme Court Rules on Trademark Case Involving Louis Vuitton Bags
data.description:
The South Korean Supreme Court has overturned a lower court's decision regarding a trademark infringement case involving Louis Vuitton bags. According to Jin10, the court ruled on February 26 that a business operator who modifies Louis Vuitton bags at the request of customers for personal use does not infringe on trademark rights. The decision came after the lower court had previously sided with Louis Vuitton's complaint.

The Supreme Court stated that when luxury bag owners request modifications for personal use and the modified bags are returned to them, it does not constitute 'use of a trademark,' even if the luxury brand's logo remains on the bags. However, the court emphasized that if the operator plays a leading role in the modification process and sells the modified luxury bags in the market, it could be considered trademark infringement.

The ruling has attracted significant attention from various regions, including the United States, Europe, and Japan, due to its considerable social impact. The Supreme Court has sent the case back to the Patent Court for a retrial.

data.title: First Resources Pays $5.6 Million for Land Transfer to Indonesian Government
data.description: First Resources, a prominent palm oil producer, has made a payment of $5.6 million related to land it was obligated to transfer to the Indonesian government. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the financial transaction as part of the company's compliance with regulatory requirements. The payment underscores the ongoing interactions between private enterprises and government authorities in Indonesia's agricultural sector. This development is part of broader efforts to ensure adherence to land use regulations in the country.

data.title: 0G Labs Launches AI Accelerator with $20 Million Funding
data.description:
0G Labs has announced the launch of the '0G Apollo Accelerator,' aimed at providing up to $20 million in funding to support the development and expansion of revenue-generating AI applications based on decentralized infrastructure. According to Odaily, this accelerator is established in collaboration with the Blockchain Builders Fund (BBF), which is part of Stanford University's blockchain ecosystem, including the Stanford Blockchain Accelerator, BASS, and MS&E 447 projects. The initiative also receives support from Google Cloud, offering each selected team $200,000 in cloud resources.

Additionally, Privy, a wallet infrastructure platform acquired by Stripe, will provide production-grade wallet solutions to the selected teams. This support is intended to equip projects with enterprise-level computing and infrastructure capabilities from the early stages.

data.title: U.S. Wages Struggle to Keep Up with Inflation Amid Rising Living Costs
data.description:
The Kobeissi Letter posted on X, highlighting the challenges faced by American households as wages struggle to keep pace with inflation. Since 2020, average weekly earnings adjusted for inflation have increased by only 3.7%, indicating that inflation has eroded most of the income gains for Americans. This situation is compounded by significant increases in living costs across the United States.

Utility gas service prices have surged by 56%, electricity prices have risen by 41%, and home insurance costs have climbed by 14% since 2020. Additionally, the prices of used cars and trucks have increased by 30%, while motor vehicle insurance has seen a 56% rise. In contrast, nominal wages have grown by 31.0% during the same period.

The disparity between wage growth and the rising costs of essential goods and services underscores the affordability issues faced by many American households. As living expenses continue to rise, the challenge of maintaining financial stability becomes increasingly difficult for the average American.

data.title: Google and OpenAI Employees Advocate for Military AI Restrictions
data.description: Employees from Google and OpenAI are actively advocating for limitations on the use of artificial intelligence in military applications. According to Jin10, this initiative reflects growing concerns among tech workers about the ethical implications and potential risks associated with AI technologies in warfare. The employees are urging their companies to establish clear policies that prevent the development and deployment of AI systems for military purposes. This movement highlights the ongoing debate within the tech industry regarding the responsible use of AI and its impact on global security. The call for restrictions comes amid increasing interest from governments and defense organizations in leveraging AI for strategic advantages. As discussions continue, the tech community is emphasizing the need for transparency and ethical guidelines to ensure AI technologies are used responsibly.

data.title: Equinor Reduces Singapore Power Operations
data.description:
Norwegian energy company Equinor has scaled back its power trading operations in Singapore. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting that this move is part of a broader strategy to streamline its global trading activities. The decision comes amid a challenging market environment and is aimed at optimizing the company's resources and focus.

Equinor's decision to reduce its presence in Singapore reflects a strategic shift in its approach to trading operations. The company has been evaluating its global trading footprint to enhance efficiency and profitability. This adjustment is expected to allow Equinor to concentrate on core markets and leverage its strengths more effectively.

The energy sector has been facing significant volatility, prompting companies like Equinor to reassess their strategies. By scaling back in Singapore, Equinor aims to better align its operations with current market conditions and future growth opportunities. The company continues to explore ways to enhance its trading capabilities while maintaining a strong presence in key regions.

data.title: 0G Labs, in partnership with the Stanford blockchain team, launched a $20 million Apollo AI Accelerator.
data.description: Decentralized AI infrastructure protocol 0G Labs announced the launch of the "0G Apollo Accelerator," offering up to $20 million in funding to incubate and scale revenue-generating AI applications based on decentralized infrastructure. The accelerator is a partnership with Blockchain Builders Fund (BBF), part of the Stanford University blockchain ecosystem, which includes projects such as the Stanford Blockchain Accelerator, BASS, and MS&E 447. The project also receives support from Google Cloud, with each selected team receiving $200,000 in cloud resources. Furthermore, wallet infrastructure platform Privy (acquired by Stripe) will provide selected teams with production-grade wallet solutions, aiming to help projects acquire enterprise-grade computing and infrastructure capabilities from an early stage.

data.title: Bitplanet Increases Bitcoin Holdings to 300 Amid Strategic Framework
data.description:
South Korean publicly traded company Bitplanet has increased its Bitcoin holdings to 300, adding 35 this week. According to ChainCatcher, the company emphasizes that this is not merely an accumulation strategy but part of a unique framework where artificial intelligence converts energy into operational cash flow, with Bitcoin serving as a store of energy value over time.

Bitplanet highlights that its Bitcoin accumulation is supported by cash flow rather than speculative actions. In the context of global debt expansion and ongoing monetary flexibility, the company believes that scarce energy-related assets are becoming increasingly important.

data.title: Bitcoin Whale Wallets Increase Amid Market Downturn
data.description: The number of Bitcoin wallets holding 100 or more BTC has approached 20,000, indicating potential bullish momentum. According to NS3.AI, on-chain analysis reveals that an increase in whale numbers often occurs during market downturns, suggesting accumulation phases. Despite this rise, the total supply held by these whales has not seen a significant increase, contributing to the persistent price pressures.

data.title: The US XRP spot ETF saw a total net inflow of $1.2163 million in a single day.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, yesterday (February 26th, Eastern Time), XRP spot ETFs saw a total net inflow of $1.2163 million. The XRP spot ETF with the largest net inflow yesterday was the Canary XRP ETF (XRPC), with a net inflow of $745,700, bringing its historical total net inflow to $414 million. The second largest was the Bitwise XRP ETF (XRP), with a net inflow of $470,600, bringing its historical total net inflow to $370 million. As of press time, the total net asset value of XRP spot ETFs was $1.016 billion, with an XRP net asset ratio of 1.19%, and a historical cumulative net inflow of $1.238 billion.

data.title: On Polymarket, the probability that "FDV's market capitalization will exceed $100 million one day after the market opens" has risen to 60%.
data.description: According to data from Polymarket, the probability that "Based's FDV market capitalization will exceed $100 million one day after its opening" has risen to 60%. Previously, Based announced the completion of an $11.5 million Series A funding round, led by Pantera Capital.
